"Make sure your Fire TV and Apple device are connected to the same WiFi network and that the app says “Service Status: Running” at the bottom of the main page.
To screencast from your Mac to Fire TV, go to System Preferences - Display and then select your Fire TV device’s name on the “AirPlay Display” drop-down menu at the bottom. Your device’s name will show up at the bottom of the AirPlay Receiver app.
To screencast from your iPhone, swipe up, hit Screen Mirroring and then select your Fire TV device’s name.
Known Issues: 1. The app won’t mirror DRM content (this is content that is protected by digital rights management software) - what won't successfully mirror will partly depend on your Apple device (iPhone/iPad/Macbook). For example, airplaying Netflix/YouTube to your Fire TV will work from your Mac, but not from your iPhone. One workaround for that is to use your phone's browser to go to YouTube/Netflix, rather than using the YouTube/Netflix app, and then airplaying.
2. Sometimes when you try to AirPlay from a laptop, there may be a router packet miscommunication resulting in the screen going black; simply end the AirPlay on your laptop (which will take you back to the main screen of the app on your Fire TV) and try again.
3.There may be lag depending on your internet connection's strength.
If it doesn’t seem to be working, we recommend trying to uninstall and reinstall the app or restarting your Fire TV.
We are very happy to help with any other issues - please feel free to contact us at zenithtechnologyenterprises@gmail.com if you need help or want to share any other feedback
We also deeply appreciate any reviews, as these help us continue to develop and improve the app."
